text: Carl Frederick Buechner ( ; July 11, 1926 â€“ August 15, 2022) was an American writer, novelist, poet, autobiographer, essayist, preacher, and theologian. He was an ordained Presbyterian minister.About Frederick Buechner. Retrieved on August 3, 2011. He was best known for his novels, including A Long Day's Dying, The Book of Bebb, Godric and Brendan. He also became known for his memoirs Telling Secrets and The Sacred Journey. His theological works, such as Secrets in the Dark, The Magnificent Defeat, and Telling the Truth were also popular.
